body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Mary W. Goodwin. Father of Lydia D. Gibson, Amelia A. Gibson, Thomas W. Gibson, Sarah G. Gibson, Charles H. Gibson, and George H.D Gibson. Graduate of West Point. Served three years on the United States sloop “Vandalia.” Studied law under George H. Dunn in 1836. Practiced law in Charlestown, Indiana until 1846. Raised Company I, Third Indiana Volunteers in the Mexican-American War. Elected to Indiana Legislature in 1848. Member of the Constitutional Committee in 1851. Moved law office to Louisville in 1848. Provost Marshal in Louisville during the Civil War.
